intro: Strobilanthes carmelensis, commonly known as the Carmel flame flower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble flames, which are composed of numerous small, tubular flowers. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is known for its seasonal blooming, often during the monsoon season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
